text: Super hazy golden coloured body with a nice, two to three centimetre tall pure white head. Aroma of pure wheat, coriander seed, lemons, curacao, bread, yeast and some good bubble gum notes - very nice and truly refreshing smelling. Light-bodied; Great bubble gum yeast qualities at first with a big dose of malt and wheat, some coriander seed freshness and touches of fruits like lemons and oranges and a big dose of flowers near the finish. Aftertaste shows some sweetness, a lot of complexities from the yeast and a very refreshing lemon and orange zest flavour coupled with mellow wheat and a touch of grass near the very end. Overall, a great example of the style and a very refreshing beer for the season or really at any time of the year - even at Christmas time and it below zero! Great to sample and well worth trying if you can find it and making it a regular beer for the summertime, especially. I sampled this sixteen ounce, pint can purchased from New Beer Distributors in New York, New York on 03-December-2016 for US$3,00 sampled at home in Pungoteague/Onancock, Virginia (Eastern Shore) on 28-May-2017.

Pours a bright, hazy golden with a medium white head that quickly fades. The aroma is what is expected in this style. Happily, its done well here. Wheat, banana, spice, lemon, yeast. The taste is slightly tart and slightly sweet. It essentially parallels the nose. Heavy in wheat and spice, still plenty of banana, some bread, lemon, and lesser orange. Some floral elements are found as well. Aftertaste is a mild and lingering duo of banana and lemon. Lighter in body, smooth in texture, and softer in carbonation. This one goes down really well. Id find it hard for someone not to like this.
Nice aroma of bubble gum, cloves, some banana. Nice golden color, white head. Sweet wheat up front. Nice mixture of cloves, orange, banana. Nice carbonation and balance on the finish.

Keg at the Midtown location, 12/17/16. Hazy straw yellow, large creamy tan head, good retention. Aroma of clove and yeast. The taste is wheat, banana, spice. Medium bodied, lingering spice. Simple and well executed.
A very good hefeweizen. Banana and cloves abound. A really solid, slick, sweet drink.
Nice wheat nose. Gold color. Very nice and authentic German style weiss bier. Full body and good balance.
500 ml can. Lemony wheat nose, good citrus, crackers, cloves. Tart and fruity flavor, biscuits and cloves, banana. Crisp, light. Good American weiss.

Draught pint at the Olympic Tavern in Rockford, IL, August 10th. Hazy gold, with a big fluffy head that dies quickly, forgotten and unloved...banana and bubblegum, just a hint of clove and allspice, some graham-cracker notes, sweet and charming but not terribly original...a bit too dry for the style, or for my taste for the style anyway (I notice Ive mentioned this a few times lately; maybe this is something American brewers still have trouble with too often), a touch of sourness (apple-cherry) thats ok along with the sourdough yeasty texture...strong carbonation, and just a little more watery than I can easily forgive. Not terrible but a bit of a disappointment.

Draft. Hazy light gold body with a frothy, white head. Aroma of toasted grain, banana, bubble gum, lemon. The flavor is moderately sweet and lightly bitter. It finishes lightly sweet and lightly bitter and lightly acidic. Medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation. Banana and light clove taste. Solid take on a German hefe.

Bottle from Julios. Poured into a tall weisse glass. A slightly hazy light orange color. Not cloudy though. Thick white head settles to a thin lace. Classic banana and clove notes. Body on the thin side. Quite tasty and refreshing.

Owl Farm, Brooklyn tap: pours hazy golden with a white head. Aroma is banana, cloves, and flowers. Taste is a little sweet. Kind of vegetal finish... Not in a bad way. Light mellow hoppibess. Ever so slightly sour at the finish. Pretty nice.
Bottle at SAVOR 2016. Golden, hazy straw color with a small fizzy head. Aroma was light floral notes, fruity character, wheat notes.

Draught @ Milk and Hops - Chelsea. Hazy dark yellow with small creamy white head, faint citrus aroma, medium carbonation, well balanced bread like taste with citrus flavor, thickish body, abrupt finish. One of the better hefeweizens.

500 ml bottle. Pours a hazy pale gold color with a large rocky white head. Yeasty wheat malt nose has obligatory notes of banana and cloves and a touch of Bazooka Joes bubblegum. First sip yields more banana and cloves along with plain popcorn. Clean fresh wheat malt notes. Tasty and refreshing. Though it has Bavarian tendencies, it lacks the complexity typical of the Fatherland. Tasty, none the less. Prost!

Solid banana and clove presence in both and aroma. Taste also brings a wonderful grain flavor that is different from that of the other American made weissbeirs Ive tried. Definitely a solid drink and something I look forward to drinking again.
A great weissbier true to its clove and banana bread aroma and taste. Has a cloudy golden color with a nice carbonation. A great all around summer beer.
On tap at conrads. Pour is cloudy straw and unfiltered. Citrus bite. Great for spring and summer season
UPDATED: APR 28, 2017 From BnC. Soft banana and clove and yeast, light body and color a little more subtle. Serving: Bottle

A classic Bavarian hefeweizen sporting a juicy banana and citrus flavor tinged with clove. Medium bodied with a sprightly carbonation that ends fruity and clean. Pours the expected hazy gold with a small frothy white head.
Aroma is lemon/fruit/citrus and mild bananas. The flavor is lemon/fruit, wheat, slight sweetness and a tart finish.

On tap at bangers and lace. Aroma is rough grain and yeast. Strong unrefined wheat and yeast flavors. Beer tastes almost unfinished. Very lightly spiced. Its different and unmistakable but I wouldnt say its very good.

UPDATED: MAY 28, 2016 Pours a hazy yellow with a white head that leaves lacing. Nose is Hefe yeast - banana notes. Taste is banana and cloves. Body is full bodied. Served at 8 degrees C Half Liter Bottle "No Born on Date"
Pours pale hazy gold into a weizen. Bright white head with medium retention recedes leaving spot lacing. Earthy banana aromas. Medium bodied with sour banana and clove front to back.
A fairly good hefeweizen. Nothing special but a really solid beer. Refeshing after a hot day.

50cl bottle. Small white head atop lightly hazed light amber body. Aroma is moderately sweet, banana, some clove, light lemon, cotton Taste is moderately sweet, lemon, some clove, banana, light seltzer. Light-medium body, light effervescence.

Pour s a lightly hazed yellow with a low, quick fading white head. Aroma has a strong clove and banana nose with light vanilla. Flavor has a lot of clove but not overdone on the spiciness. Banana and nutmeg also creep into the flavor late. Body is perfect with a bit of a chewy texture from the wheat malt, sharp carbonation and slight dryness at the end. Another great beer by UC. I really enjoy the dedication of this brewery to true German styles and not succumbing the "imperialization" trend often seen in the American market.

ヘフェバイツ  
バナナの香り&

This beer pours a hazy bright golden color with a medium thick fluffy white head that dissipates gradually. Patchy lacing on the glass. Aroma of herbal wheat, banana and malt. Light-bodied with flavors of doughy malt, banana, wheat and a touch of floral yeast. The finish is fruity and wheaty with a banana aftertaste. Decent overall.
Classic hefe aroma of clove, nutmeg, and banana. Flavor follows suit. Very bready. Slightly watery. Nice hefe.

Bottle shared by bhensonb. Pours clear golden with a transient white head and a fruity atoma. There is a light wheat flavor with some banana and clove from the yeast esters. Nicely carbonated with an earthy finish.

Bottle from Wine & Cheese. Pours gold with a slight white head. Aroma is light clove and banana. Med minus body? Flavor is banana and a touch of clove with some fuit. Finishes a tad earthy/phenolic. Decent.
had a couple of times over at the ginger bread house in rice .. . slight bubblegum, hay, and wheat .. . clean and dirty at the same time, nice beer .. . . cricket world cup

Had on tap at their place. Pours a slightly hazy light yellow with a thin white head. Aroma is slight wheat bubblegum. Some banana and clove. Nice. Creamy mouthfeel. Really nice beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Pours a cloudy yellow with small white head. The aroma is strong clove and yeast. Similar flavors to nose, banana and spice, good.
Pale yellow pour with a frothy white head. Aroma is clove and banana. Taste is clove, slight banana in the finish. Refreshing. Crisp finish. Nice wheat body. OK lacing.
Bottle. Lactic lemon, clove and wheat malt aroma. Hazy golden yellow with small head. Sweet-tart lemon-orange, clove and wheat malt flavor. Nice body. Very nice.

Draft to taster. Looks solid; a hazy lemon with white lacing. Smells solid too; a nice balance of banana and clove. Tastes like it smells with a medium light-bodied mouthfeel. Im not much of a hefe guy, but this one is solid.

Bottle:
Clear, very pale yellow with a tall white head.
Lemon, yeast,..light banana scent.
Sharp wheat, citrus, clove....a little banana in flavor.
A very solid, no-frills Hefe.
A little bland, but good.

16.9 oz bottle purchased at Lukas Liquors in Martin City, Missouri. The pour is hazed golden orange with a smaller white head. The aroma is wheat grain, clove and soft banana fruit. Traditional Hefeweizen nose. The taste is a clean blend of the clove, wheat grain, and soft banana fruit sweetness. Clean, mineral earth spice finish. Sweetness picks up some as it warms, though its clean and natural. The palate is light to medium bodied, unfiltered mouth feel and the clean finish. Nice traditional Hefeweizen.
Tap. Pours hazy golden, small white head, no real lacing. Aroma is clove, wheat, banana. Flavor is light sweet and follows. Lots of banana and clove, a bit of lingering spice. Very solid.
Drank this flight at the Chestnut Brewery with my loving family. I dont think I like this one.
Lemon and tangy. A little bitter. Underwhelming like most of their beers. Doesn't taste bad but not my style. Had this on tap as part of a flight at urban chestnut brewery.

Pour on tap at the brewery, hazy straw yellow with white head, aroma brought wheat, grass, banana, clove, hints of white fruit as well, some bready notes. Taste is a ix of clove, banana, yeast, bread, hints of earth, some grass, finishing sweet, dry. Pretty tasty.

This, for me, was sort of like a Hefeweizen-lite or maybe even a kristalweizen because it just didnt come permeated by wheaty, yeasty goodness. While it was definitely carbonated and had a slight tart cirtusy flavor, it was relatively dilute compared to some of the other hefeweizens Ive had that are wheat/yeast/banana through and through. All in all not bad though.

Keg @ Urban Chestnut. Hazy gold with a small head. Banana, bubblegum, peah and clove. Taste is of crisp honeyed apple. Somewhat yeasty. Juicy fruit bubble gum. Graham crackers. Light body, soft carbonation. Solid.

Bottle. Pours a hazy light gold with a fizzy head and aromas of cloves and other spicy esters. Flavor is light and peppery, but thin. Kind of like a watered down version of what I would expect from the style. Not bad, but I was hoping for a much more assertive beer.
user_location: The Wet Side of a Dry Town, Pennsylvania, USA

text: Hdbdh :/ dvvdiibdbbcoie. Fnd dkx d ck d xkj d. Xjj d. Xjjjhvvhjxbvejj dee v. Cjcjhhxhdhehxjhgd :/

On tap @ Urban Chestnut. Hazed golden pour with a white head. Sweet banana, bread, and a bit of clove. Nice bubblegum, some citrus, and a touch of yeast. Really nice banana, clove, and bready malt. Nice dough as well. Good estery beer. A bit of yeast and bubblegum. Nice and easy drinking.
Gold/yellow pour with white head and lace. Aroma is lemon, corriander, and wheat. Touch of sweet malt flavor along with the spices from the aroma. Medium bodied with good carbonation.
Bottle at home. Pours cloudy yellow. No head. Nose/taste of banana, lemon citrus, clove, wheat malt and bubblegum. Lighter bodied. Refreshing.

Taster at the brewpub during RBSG. Mostly clear golden color. Thin ring of bubbly head. Some loose lace. Medium body. Smooth, soft, crisp lighter carbonation. More dry finish. Some hefe yeast, light spice aromas. Light to moderate sweet, light spicy taste. Solid, interesting wheat ale.

Draft @ Bridge Tap House & Wine Bar, St Louis, MO. Pours a hazy yellow color with a small white head. Has a fruity wheat malty spicy clove aroma. Fruity wheat malty spicy clove and banana flavor. Has a wheat malty spicy banana finish.

4 oz draft pour at Urban Chestnut Midtown during RBSG 2014. Hazy yellow with off-white head. Aromas of floral, herbs, spices, malt. Tastes of citrus, floral, sweet malt, peppery, spices. Medium body, dry finish. Light mouthfeel.

Bottle and served in my new UB Maifest glass: Expected hazy golden hue with a surprisingly small head and lace. Moderate clove and banana esters along with a tad more hop bitterness than normally associated with the very best of the genre. That "minerally" tone I found frequently in their beers is here too, even a faint hint of band-aid. A nice enough beer but it is not even remotely amongst the top 12 in the world like RateBeer has. I would rather have a Piece Hefeweizen (or if I had access a Live Oak Hefeweizen) over this... or of course any of the great German Holy Trinity of the style.

Draft flight on tap at the brewpub (St. Louis, MO). Pours a golden straw hue, pale and gently hazed with frothy whitish head atop. Sticks around as a decent ring, nice lacing. Aromas are fruity, a bit of flaked wheat with banana, gentle estery elements, straw and bread. Touch of earth. Initial is lighter end of the fold, a bit lemony with flaked wheat, touches of vanilla, gentle yeastiness. Middle is a touch bready, dry with gentle banana, mellow yeastiness and flaked wheat. A touch dry, faint tartness. Backend is dry, a bit yeasty and banana. Touch of sweetness but nothing overdone. Solid.
Draft. Very estery weissbier, banana, bubblegum, slight lemon, a pretty decent one.

This is cloudy and very pale witha little head of fine bubbles. It has a touch of banana along w/ a vegetal spice character. it is light with a very nice creamy texture and heavy carb. It is slightly sweet and very slightly tart which brings out the jucisness of the banana once tasted. It finishes w/ a light lingering fruitiness. This is a solid hefe but I prefer them w/ a more vibrant fruity nose.
The BEST hefeweizen brewed on this side of the Atlantic. No one but the Germans could do it better.
Draft. Strong banana and bubble gym esters with moderate clove. Pour is very light yellow and hazy. Taste is also strong banana with some vanilla. A very tame clove presence which I like. Very good.

Sampled from the tap at the brewpub. Pours a near clear straw yellow with a a white head that dissipates to the edges. Aroma has a lots of fruit and nutmeg with some light sweet wheat underlying. Flavor has lots of sweet wheat and clove with some earthy and sweet wheat backing.

The color is a cloudy golden with a large white head that fades somewhat slowly, and the aroma is reminiscent of wheat, light banana, citrus, and dough yeast. The taste is slightly sweet and a touch sour with a complementary palate that is medium in body, thick in texture, softly carbonated, and wheat-filled through the finish.

16oz bottle. Pours a hazy straw color with a small fizzy head. Aroma of citrus, tropical fruit and yeast. Taste of citrus, banana, spice and just a bit of malt sweetness. Mild bitterness and a tart finish. Fairly light body, quite smooth with a tart feel. Nice beer.
On tap. Comes a cloud pale gold with a small white head. Aroma of fruit, malt, and spice. Taste is malt, banana, spice, and citrus. Very easy to drink. Nice.
A tasty Weissbier. Foamy head hazy golden color. Smell is fruity. Taste is banana and malts. Clean crisp finish. Nice!
Draft pour at the source. Pours a hazy pale yellow with a white head of foam. The aroma is a little smoky and bready. Some dried fruits. A little phenolic. High carbonation and light body.

Bright and floral, but also with a serious malty hay strength. Notes of banana bread, slight bubblegum. Great bright carbonation. Unlike a lot of wheat beers leaves a complex, sparkly and satisfying finish.

Shared growler poured to snifters, showing a hazed, orangey color, with a nice layer of white head froth, and waves & spots of lacing. The nose was circus peanuts,(banana candy) citrus as orange, a touch of sweetness, and light spice as clove. The taste was similar notes, tart & tangy, with lively carbonation, also a bit of sweetness, maybe nutmeg, but I felt it was more a touch of light grain or biscuit. Refreshing, sessionable, and nicely palate cleansing.

My first beer from Urban Chestnut (finally!) and- full beer geek mode- poured by Stan Hieronymus. I didnt take formal notes, but the beer looked as a standard Hefe- cloudy bright gold with a slightly bubbly white head. More bubblegum yeast than banana; a touch of clove in the nose. The flavor continues more of the same with the clove more apparent toward the finish. The palate was velvety soft and chewy. Really well done. Thanks, Stan!

16oz bottle thanks to Strykzone via local swap 5.2. Pours a cloudy light straw color with a small foamy white head. Aroma of grass, hay, lemon citrus, and Belgian yeast. Taste of of hay, lemon zest, grass, and wheat.

Poured a hazy yellow color with aromas of bananas, light clove some grass and a touch of bubble gum. Flavors are the same, bananay yeast not overpowering just right. An easy drinker for the Florida summer heat.

1/6/2014. On tap. Cloudy pale yellow with a white head. Banana, spice, yeast and grassy aromas. Clove and spice flavors with fruit. Probably my least favorite style of beer, but this one was not bad at all.

16 oz bottle pours hazy golden with a white head. Aroma of yeast, malts and bananas. Taste is bananas, bread, spice and malts. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from trade with Strykezone. 

Champagne colored body with white head. Aromas are banana, dough. Taste is similar...light bodied with distinctive hefeweizen traits.

UPDATED: SEP 21, 2014 A yeast aroma with notes of small floral notes with a cloudy appearance. It has a medium body palate with a bit of dryness. Notes of citrus and bread. A decent american weissbier.

Appearance: light yellow with lots of haze, pours with a very tall off white head that settles into a moderate and dense head, looks like a great hefe

Aroma: strong banana, yeast, lemon, bread, smells strong and pleasant

Taste: lemon, yeast, bread, froth 

Palate: very frothy, leaves mouth kind of dry, softer carbonation, minimal aftertaste maybe some lemon or grass

Overall: just a classic hefeweizen that belongs in the same class as the best hefeweizens, great beer, if not not unique

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

I had this at Global Brew. Pours cloudy yellow with a thick white head. Taste banana, bit of citrus, light. This was like drinking a German Hefeweizen. I thought this was very good. I would definitely drink this again.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Banana, clove, bubblegum, dough, hay, toast, citrus, alcohol, citrus, grass, floral, roasty

A hazy yellow/light orange color with a little bit of white head. Smells of banana, clove, coriander. A light sweet and spice taste with banana, caramel, clove, a little pepper finishes smooth with little bitter. Beautiful drinking beer, very much enjoyed. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at the brewpub a few months back, a lost old rating, pours a hazy yellow with a thin head, the aroma is of nice banana and yeast, comes through really nicely, the flavor has a good mix of banana and spices with a tart finish, the vanilla and nutmeg make this hefe a little different, but I dig it, nice.

Appearance is pale yellow, cloudy, with a thick white foam cap that dissipated quickly for a weizen. Aroma is spicy banana and clove. Taste is a sweet bready malt with coriander like spice with banana. Mouthfeel is slightly creamy. Finishes with a bit of lemony citrus and tartness.

On tap at GTMW 2013 - Pours hazy yellow with a thin white head. Nose is banana, wheaty with light clove. Taste is bubblegum, wheat, banana, clove, and a bit of sweetness. Nice and thick and well-carbonated.

Tap - fair size foamy head, pale straw color, medium wheat aroma and flavor, very mild hefe like spice, expected it to be a little better

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a hazy golden yellow with two fingers of bright white head and good lacing. Aroma of banana bread with some vanilla. Banana is more subdued in taste with some graininess, a bit of vanilla and prominent clove flavor that borders on being phenolic in aftertaste. Finishes semi dry. Mouthfeel is crisp and smooth, medium bodied with moderate/high carbonation. Nice and drinkable with good flavor.

2013 bottle fresh off the conveyer from the brewery into a wine glass. Color is a hazy straw yellow. Aroma is yeasty with some tropical fruit and a little spice. Taste is the same with clove and some citrus. Crisp and clean, especially on the finish. A thin mouthfeel.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle (Reverence series #2). Pours with a moderately hazy yellow hued body with a large and fluffy white head. Great lace. Tight bubble grouping, good retention and lace. Aromas of earthy and almost a bit husky phenol. Typical 4VG, bready and wheat like malt. Very dry aroma. Some isoamyl acetate. Really an underripe banana/plantain nose. Almost some ceylon cinnamon. Grassy. Quite dry for a hefe, big bready malt, lots of bubblegum, mild isoamyl, mild 4vg. Very dry, missing some of the body of fresher classical examples. Quite drinkable though. Balance is slightly towards phenol with a good deal of malt. Nice. Lively carbonation, medium body, light acidity.

Draft @ Urban Chestnut A - Pours a hazy golden with big pillow white head. Good Retention. Ok lacing. S - Yeast, clove, bubblegum, banana, and lemon zest. Nice Nose. T - Sweet malted wheat, lightly spiced, bit of citrus. M - Lght/medium bodied. Soft carbonation. Smooth texture. Clean, lightly sweet finish. O - Refreshing. Very Solid Hefe.

Pours hazy pale golden orange with a large white head. Smells lightly fruity, with hints of bubblegum. Taste is a little of banana, a little of clove, a little sweet. Light-bodied with a slick texture and fizzy mouth-carbonation, Urban Chestnut Schnickelfritz finishes with a light sweetness.

UPDATED: JUN 4, 2013 Courtesy of Strykzone. Thanks Dave.,  Poured a cloudy yellow color. Big while. Light lacing.  Medium body.  Smooth mouthfeel. Nose of banana and wheat.  Flavor is light with lemon and cloves. Tasty.

Tap at baileys range st louis mo
Pours hazy lite orange with a small spritzy head off white
Nose is tyoical hefe babana vanilla grainsvand some clove a little on the medicinal side flavors are huge bubblegum vanilka and banana very true to style however nothing really exciting a litter mineral character which is somewhat ofsetting and a little thin on the body decent lots of grainy notes on the finish

UPDATED: JUN 25, 2014 On tap at Urban Chestnut on Jan 11th.  Pours a hazy golden color with white head.  Yeasty, wheat, clove flavors.  Doesn?t quite hit the mark for a german hefeweizen.  I am a little surprised at how highly rated this is by style. Re-rate: Sampled at Urban Chestnut during RBSG. Pours a hazy golden color with white head. Clove, yeasty, banana aromas. Refreshing clove, yeasty, wheat flavors. Better than last time, but still not an amazing German-style wheat.

Bottle.

Head is initially average sized, frothy, white, mostly diminishing.
Body is hazy light to medium yellow.

Aroma is lightly to moderately malty (toasted grain), lightly yeasty (basement), with a note of lemon zest/pith, light notes of gum, popcorn, and pepper.

Flavor is moderately sweet, lightly acidic, lightly bitter.
Finish is lightly sweet, lightly acidic, lightly to moderately bitter.

Light to medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation.

Another weird one, considering how much of a banana-bomb the Winged Nut is...theres almost none here, vaguely gum-like maybe, very little pepper or clove either.  And the voluminous head of most German wheats is absent as well.  Its almost more of an American-style wheat than anything else, as the prominent aromatic elements are lemon rind and toasty-wheaty malt.  Regardless of that argument, overall theres just not much aromatic intensity or depth, and its somewhat light, watery, and bland in the mouth as well.  A little popcorny too, which is always a turn-off for me.  Dunno what to say, its pretty blah and not really to style IMHO.

bottle. cloudy golden wheat with a large-growing fine white head and lasting retention.  gummy banana / tropical esters in the nose with a minerallic, slightly-sulfuric, very Bavarian yeast character.  low but round and full carbonation releases peppery phenols and acids across the tongue.  very close to Bavarian, though sweeter than I like, but theres a lot of hefeweizen in Germany that matches the level found here.  solid product by a talented brewer.

January 8, 2013 on tap at brewpub. Deep cloudy yellow pour with some head. Aroma was strong banana, clove and yeast. Taste was clove and yeast up front with a nice banana finish. Very smooth for the style which is nice because some can have a harsh finish.

Draft at Urban Chestnut. Pours a milky/cloudy gold with a stiff white head. The nose is as good as any hefeweizen Ive had. Banana & vanilla, light citrus notes and cloves. Robust grainy wheat crackers as well. On tasting, light bodied but creamy on the palate. Lots of hefe esters with some soft cloves. rich and full, smooth across the palate. Superb.

UPDATED: JAN 11, 2013 Bottle @ home, courtesy of jcnielsen. Im not going to lie- Im excited as fuck to try this, but am a bit nervous based on the amount of homerism that occurs in STL. Here goes... Pours a cloudy yellow-orange appearance with a white head. Fairly spicy, huge phenolic, banana, clove, vanilla, a bit overly yeasty, lemon nose. Very spicy, chewy yeasty, clove/nutmeg, a touch tart citrusy flavor. Hmmm, not necessarily off, but the yeasty elements seem to be overdone. Not bad but not worthy of the 99th percentile in my opinion.
Very strong banana.  Cloudy opaque.  Some spices.  No head.  Very drinkable.  Some citrus.
Draft, pours hazy yellow foamy white head. Aroma has nice banana and clove thing, fresh citrus peel. Flavors are fresh banana and clove, citrus, creamy bread dough. Sturdy hefe, great example of one.
Hazy yellow pour with a white head.  The aroma has some lemon along with wheat.  It has a light, thin body with average carbonation.  The taste is mildly sweet with an easy finish.

Tasted on  tap at the brewpub in a weiss glass. Cloudy yellow color with thick, moussy foam. Aromas of freshly-cut grass, husky whole grains, french bread, noble hops, light clove, bubble gum, marshmallow, vanilla and very faint banana. Light body, nice light bready, chalky, mineral-water mouthfeel, lasting bittersweet finish. Refreshing and tasty. 100% true-to-style German weiss beer, but I still prefer more banana esters, such as Schlafly Weissbier.

So I am currently at Busch Stadium watching my beloved Mets lose to my fiancés Cardinals. I am surrounded by a sea of red and everyone is too Midwest nice to give me shit for being a Mets fan, it makes things even worse. The bright side is that Urban Chstnut has their beer on tap here. Cost is $7.50 for a 16oz plastic cup. Pretty sweet deal if you compare it to 7 bucks for a Blue Moon.  The beer pours with a nice thick head atop a thick golden body. Aroma is hefe banana with some grainy yeast knees. Flavor follows suit with very drinkable subdued banana esters ad sweet banana cream like graininess. By far the best beer I have ever purhased at a major league park.  I dont get this part, why is Terry Collins pinch hitting for the starter in the top of the fifth?  He has only given up 4 runs. Are we is abundance of unworked relievers?
user_location: HdG (past: NYC, KS, Rain City), Maryland, USA

text: Pours hazy golden with a two finger head with great heavy lacing.cereal malt with mild grassy and herbal hops.full body with soft carbonation. Long mild sweet finish.very good
On tap at Urban Chestnut. Pours cloudy golden yellow with white head. Aromas of banana, clove, lemon, and wheat. Flavors of banana, clove, wheat, and lemon. Very well done for style.

Draft at the Dubliner. Pours cloudy pineapple with a thin white head. Big banana on the nose. Lots of bubble gum on the tongue with a hint of dryness in the finish so it doesnt become cloying. This is a damn good hefe!
Draught at brewery. Big banana noxe. Wheat. Lots of yeast pushing flavor. Dry to some extent. Very tasty.

Draft at the brewpub.  My wife had to have this because her grandpa used to call her Schnicklefritz.  Best surprise of the day was this classic Bavarian Weizenbier.   Sticky white head, hazy pale yellow body, tropical fruit aroma, and classic yeast and banana favors all rolled into one.  Excellent example of style.  (#4489, 2/24/2012)

UPDATED: APR 4, 2012 Pours as a beautiful hefeweizen.  Cloudy yellow/gold with a big eggwhite head that lasts throughout.  Soft banana, clove and wet bread aroma.  Smooth, refreshing hefeweizen taste of the same, but a little on the dry side.  Not a criticism, just an observation.  Seriously good.

draft... strong aroma of bubblegum in this, nailed the yeast profile perfectly, however there is also a huge note of vomit that almost makes me gag, tough to smell... tastes fine, none of the arome lingers... good but tough to recommend due to the aroma

Sampled at the brewery.  Very very cloudy orange yellow.  A nice white foam and cool lacing.  Banana and yeast nose.  Flavor is soft.  Banana, lemon, clove, and grass.  This is light fare and is a nice beer.
tap at urban chestnut.   bright dry doughy herbal banana.  touch of creamed wheat.  light herbal, peary fruit, cream, and vanilla notes as well.   good, to style, nice.

(draught at brewpub) hazy yellow gold with fluffy white head and nice lace. Mild clove aroma. Flavor was mild wheat, some vanilla. Very little banana and clove for a hefeweizen (a good thing for me - Im not a big clove fan).

On tap at Urban Chestnut brewpub.  Shnickelfritz, schmikelfritz.  Cloudy milky yellow with a white crown.  Aroma of banana, clove and yeast.  Taste is spot on with banana, clove, yeast, wheat and nut bark.  Decent hefe.

Pour is a cloudy blonde with a large white head.  Aroma is nice with lots of banana and wheat.  I can smell it w/o even bringing the glas to my nose.  Flavor is your typicall hefe with some clove, banana and wheat but all really stand out on their own.  A well made hefe and my fav from this brewer so far.

Sampler at the brewpub.  A very good hefe, not too overwhelming, done just right.  This one hit the spot as far as what a hefe should be.  The taste seemed to get better as I was about half way through the brew.

Pours hazy yellow with a snow white head.  The aroma has banana, cloves, wheat (thinner than most) and is more dry than rich.  It is quite yeasty and shows a bit of creaminess.  Medium / full body thats quite smooth and feels richer than the taste.  The flavor starts off with cloves, nutmeg and spicy flavors giving it a dryer than normal taste for a hefe.  There is a bit of cream and hints of bubblegum, but it doesnt have much sweetness.  The finish has some mineral traits.  Good hefe.

Had on draft at the tasting room. Pours extremley cloudy pale yellow. Has a creamy thick white head. The aroma is bananna, clove, wheat and malts. Has hints of vanilla in the aroma as well. Taste is bready, malty  with a strong emphasis on the bananna, clove and wheat. Threre is quite a bit of yeast in the finish as well. Overall a great Hefeweizen.

UPDATED: MAR 7, 2011 Draft served in a big, tall weiss glass at the brewpub on opening day. Pours a very cloudy pale yellow color with darker shades in the center and a finger-thick creamy white head. Aroma of bready malts, banana, clove, vanilla, cream, and wheat. Hits all the right notes with a strong underlying creaminess and breadiness. The flavor follows along these lines, but the wheat, clove, and banana play a larger role than in the nose; the cream and bready and pale malts round it out with a decent amount of yeast in the finish. There seems to be a hint of vanilla in the flavor, too. Medium-bodied, with moderate carbonation and a bready, wheaty mouthfeel. This one is right on the money in terms of what a hefeweizen could and should be and I found myself liking the beer mid-way through more than I did in the initial sips. Great intro to Urban Chestnut!
